questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for solution version releases will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Do you have a fully implemented solution support strategy that defines how many concurrent versions you support?
questions.standard_guidance: List the current version you support and what percentage of customers are utilizing that version.
questions.no_guidance: Clarify the lack of support strategy for concurrent versions in your solution.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe or provide a reference to your solution support strategy in regard to maintaining software currency (i.e., how many concurrent versions are you willing to run and support?).
questions.na_guidance: Please explain why this does not apply to your organization, product or service.
questions.reason: Supporting multiple versions of a solution is challenging. Understanding the solution provider’s strategy and resources will provide insight into its ability to adequately support their customers.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for the solution provider’s support of concurrent versions will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Do you have a release schedule for product updates?
questions.no_guidance: State any plans to release a schedule of product updates.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a reference to this solution's release schedule.
questions.na_guidance: Please explain why this does not apply to your organization, product or service.
questions.reason: Answers to this question will reveal the solution provider’s ability to plan in the short term. This is valuable information for customers so they can anticipate updates and potential bug fixes.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for the solution provider’s solution update practices will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Do you have a technology roadmap, for at least the next two years, for enhancements and bug fixes for the solution being assessed?
questions.no_guidance: State any plans to release a technology roadmap covering the next two years.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a reference to your technology roadmap.
questions.reason: Answers to this question will reveal the solution provider’s ability to plan for the future of their solution.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for the solution provider’s technology planning practices will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Can solution updates be completed without institutional involvement (i.e., technically or organizationally)?
questions.no_guidance: Summarize the institution's responsibilities during solution updates.
questions.reason: The response to this question allows the institution to understand the information technology resources required to properly maintain the solution provider's system. Initial acquisition and setup is important to assess, but the long-term maintenance (and the risks that come with it) should be clearly defined. Use the response to this question to pivot to other questions and/or verify other solution provider responses.
questions.followup: Vague responses to this question should be investigated further. Ask for additional documentation for customer responsibilities (in the context of information technology/security).

questions.question: Are upgrades or system changes installed during off-peak hours or in a manner that does not impact the customer?
questions.no_guidance: Decribe plans to minimize the impact of downtime based on predefined off-peak hours.
questions.yes_guidance: Define current off-peak hours, including time zones as necessary.
questions.reason: Restricting system updates to a standard maintenance timeframe is important for ensuring that changes to production systems do not impact operations. It’s also important for troubleshooting any problems that may occur as a result of the changes.
questions.followup: If the solution provider's response does not cover the details outlined in the reasoning, follow up and get specific responses, as needed.

questions.question: Do procedures exist to provide that emergency changes are documented and authorized (including after-the-fact approval)?
questions.no_guidance: Describe plans to implement procedure ensuring that emergency changes are documented and authorized.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize implemented procedures ensuring that emergency changes are documented and authorized.
questions.reason: In the context of the CIA triad, this question is focused on system integrity, ensuring that system changes are only executed by authorized users. In the event of emergency changes, accountability and post-action review are expected.
questions.followup: Follow up with a robust question set if a solution provider cannot clearly state full control of the integrity of their system(s).

questions.question: Do you have a systems management and configuration strategy that encompasses servers, appliances, cloud services, applications, and mobile devices (company and employee owned)?
questions.no_guidance: Describe your intent to implement a systems management and configuration strategy.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize your systems management and configuration strategy.
questions.reason: In the context of the CIA triad, this question is focused on system integrity, ensuring that system changes are only executed by authorized users. Additionally, it is expected that devices (for administrators, solution provider staff, and affiliates) that are used to access the solution provider's systems are properly managed and secured.
questions.followup: Follow up with a robust question set if the solution provider cannot clearly state full control of the integrity of their system(s). Questions about administrator access on end-user devices and other maintenance and patching type questions are appropriate.

questions.question: Will the institution's data be stored on any devices (database servers, file servers, SAN, NAS, etc.) configured with non-RFC 1918/4193 (i.e., publicly routable) IP addresses?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.yes_guidance: State the need for this strategy, in detail.
questions.reason: Systems that are directly exposed to public internet resources are at greater risk than those that are not. Understanding the requirements for this configuration is important, particularly when assessing compensating controls.
questions.followup: Ask the solution provider about its infrastructure and if there is a solution that eliminates the need for this environment.

questions.question: Is the transport of sensitive data encrypted using security protocols/algorithms (e.g., system-to-client)?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe why sensitive data is not encrypted in transport.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize your transport encryption strategy.
questions.reason: The need for encryption in transport is unique to your institution's implementation of a system. In particular, the data flow between the system and the end users of the solution.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for data encryption between the system and end-users will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Is the storage of sensitive data encrypted using security protocols/algorithms (e.g., disk encryption, at-rest, files, and within a running database)?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe why sensitive data is not encrypted in storage.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize your data encryption strategy and state what encryption options are available.
questions.reason: The need for encryption at-rest is unique to your institution's implementation of a system. In particular, system components, architectures, and data flows all factor into the need for this control.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for data encryption at-rest will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Do all cryptographic modules in use in your solution conform to the Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS PUB 140-2 or 140-3)?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Provide a detailed description of all non-conforming modules.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide reference to FIPS 140-3 validation certificates.
questions.reason: Beware the use of proprietary encryption implementations. Open standard encryption, preferably mature, is often preferred. Although there may be cases in which that is not the case, be sure to understand the solution provider's infrastructure and the true security of a solution provider's solution.
questions.followup: If the solution provider cannot accommodate open standards encryption requirements, direct them to NIST's Cryptographic Standards and Guidelines document <https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/Cryptographic-Standards-and-Guidelines>.

questions.question: Will the institution's data be available within the system for a period of time at the completion of this contract?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe your data export procedures conducted at the termination of contract.
questions.yes_guidance: State the length of time that the institution's data will be available in the system at the completion of the contract.
questions.reason: When cancelling a solution, an institution will commonly want all institutional data that was provided to a solution provider. This questions allows the solution provider to state their general practices when a customer leaves their environment.
questions.followup: A solution provider's response should be clear and concise. Be wary of vague responses to this questions and inquire about export specifics, as needed.

questions.question: Are ownership rights to all data, inputs, outputs, and metadata retained even through a provider acquisition or bankruptcy event?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Provide a detailed description why rights are not retained.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide references, as needed.
questions.reason: This question clarifies the position of the institution in the case of acquisition or bankruptcy. Expect clear responses to this question. If they are vague, be sure to follow up based on institutional counsel guidance.
questions.followup: If a solution provider's response is unsatisfactory, engage institutional counsel to appropriately address any ownership concerns.

questions.question: Do backups containing the institution's data ever leave the institution's data zone either physically or via network routing?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize why backups containing the institution's data leave the institution's data zone.
questions.reason: Data exposure is a risk if sensitive data is in any way transported (physically or electronically) into a data zone that is not authorized by the institution. Depending on the criticality of data and institution policy, full control of data confidentiality may be highly valued.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for data backup procedures/practices will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Is media used for long-term retention of business data and archival purposes stored in a secure, environmentally protected area?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State plans to store long-term media in environmentally protected areas.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a general summary of your archival environment.
questions.reason: Managing media (and the data within) throughout its lifecycle is crucial to the protection of institutional data. The focus of this question is confidentiality, ensuring that media that may store institutional data is protected by well-established policy and procedure.
questions.followup: Vague responses to this question should be investigated further. Ask for additional documentation and verify that procedure (and possibly training) exists to ensure proper media handling activity.

questions.question: At the completion of this contract, will data be returned to the institution and/or deleted from all your systems and archives?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.standard_guidance: Please specify if it will be returned, deleted, or both.
questions.no_guidance: State plans to implement capabilities for the institution to retrieve its data.
questions.yes_guidance: State the length of time that the institution's data will be available in the system at the completion of the contract.
questions.reason: When cancelling a solution, an institution will commonly want all institutional data that was provided to a solution provider. This question allows the solution provider to state its general practices when a customer leaves its environment.
questions.followup: A solution provider's response should be clear and concise. Be wary of vague responses to this questions and inquire about export specifics, as needed.

questions.question: Can the institution extract a full or partial backup of data?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State plans to implement capabilities for the institution to extract a full or partial backup of data.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a general summary of how full and partial backups of data can be extracted.
questions.reason: When cancelling a solution, an institution will commonly want all institutional data that was provided to a solution provider. The solution provider's response should verify if the institution can extract data or if it is a manual extraction by solution provider staff.
questions.followup: A solution provider's response should be clear and concise. Be wary of vague responses to this questions and inquire about export specifics, as needed.

questions.question: Do current backups include all operating system software, utilities, security software, application software, and data files necessary for recovery?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State plans to include the elements listed in DATA-13 in your backup strategy.
questions.yes_guidance: Decribe your overall strategy to accomplish these elements.
questions.reason: The purpose of this question is to define the scope of backup operations and the scope at which a solution provider may readily recover when backup restoration is required.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for backup content scope will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Are you performing off-site backups (i.e., digitally moved off site)?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State any plans to implement off-site virtual backups in your environment.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize your off-site backup strategy.
questions.reason: When data is moved digitally (e.g., cloud provider, solution provider-owned facility, etc.) off-site, the policies and implemented procedures are important to know. The protections implemented to prevent compromise will be technical in nature and should be well-documented.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for off-site, digital backups will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Are physical backups taken off-site (i.e., physically moved off site)?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State any plans to implement off-site physical backups in your environment.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide the distance (in miles) between the primary and off-site locations.
questions.reason: When data is moved physically (e.g.,HDD, print, etc.) off-site, the policies and implemented procedures are important to know. Unencrypted data taken outside secured areas introduces unnecessary risks.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for off-site, physical backups will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Are data backups encrypted?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Summarize why backups are not encrypted.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize the encryption algorithm/strategy you are using to secure backups.
questions.reason: The need for encryption at rest (for backups) is unique to your institution's implementation of a system. In particular, system components, architectures, and data flows all factor into the need for this control.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for data backup encryption at-rest will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Do you have a media handling process that is documented and currently implemented that meets established business needs and regulatory requirements, including end-of-life, repurposing, and data-sanitization procedures?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Provide a detailed summary of media handling processes that do exist.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide documented details of this process (link or attached).
questions.reason: Managing media (and the data within) throughout its lifecycle is crucial to the protection of institutional data. The focus of this question is confidentiality, ensuring that media that may store institutional data is protected by well-established policy and procedure.
questions.followup: Vague responses to this question should be investigated further. Ask for additional documentation and verify that procedure (and possibly training) exists to ensure proper media handling activity.

questions.question: Does the process described in DATA-15 adhere to DoD 5220.22-M and/or NIST SP 800-88 standards?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State plans to adhere to DoD 5220.22-M and/or NIST SP 800-88 standards.
questions.reason: Managing media (and the data within) throughout its lifecycle is crucial to the protection of institutional data. The focus of this question is confidentiality, ensuring that media that may store institutional data is protected by well-established policy and procedure.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for DoD 5220.22-M and/or SP800-88 standards will be institution specific.

questions.question: Does your staff (or third party) have access to institutional data (e.g., financial, PHI, or other sensitive information) through any means?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize what access staff (or third parties) have to institutional data.
questions.reason: Confidentiality is the focus of this question. Based on the capabilities of solution provider administrators, the institution may require additional safeguards to protect the confidentiality of data stored by or shared with a solution provider (e.g., additional layer of encryption, etc.).
questions.followup: If institutional data is visible by the solution provider's system administrators, follow up with the solution provider to understand the scope of visibility, process/procedure that administrators follow, and use cases when administrators are allowed to access (view) institutional data.

questions.question: Do you have a documented and currently implemented strategy for securing employee workstations when they work remotely (i.e., not in a trusted computing environment)?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a detailed summary outlining the security controls implemented to protect the institution's data.
questions.reason: Telecommuting in the IT world is the norm, and an institution should know that proper safeguards are in place when remote access is allowed. Solution Provider responses vary greatly, so confirm the context of the response if it is not clear. Many cloud services can only be managed remotely, so there is often a gray area to interpret for this response. In the context of the CIA triad, this question is focused on confidentiality. Printed documents, mobile device use, and remote access are all relevant to this question. A solution provider's response to this question will provide insight into their overall business process. Solution Provider business activity that poses additional security risks should be met with increased concern.
questions.followup: Vague responses to this question should be investigated further. Ask for additional documentation and verify that procedure (and possibly training) exists to ensure proper customer data handling activity.

questions.question: Does the environment provide for dedicated single-tenant capabilities? If not, describe how your solution or environment separates data from different customers (e.g., logically, physically, single tenancy, multi-tenancy).
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe your plan to separate institution data from that of other customers.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe or provide a reference to how institution data is separated from that of other customers.
questions.reason: A solution provider's response to this question can reveal a system's infrastructure quickly. Off-point responses are common here, so general follow-up is often needed. Understanding how a solution provider segments its customers' data (or doesn't) affects various other controls, including network settings, use of encryption, access controls, etc. A solution provider's response here will influence potential follow-up inquiries for other HECVAT questions.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for dedicated single-tenant capabilities will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Are ownership rights to all data, inputs, outputs, and metadata retained by the institution?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe in detail why ownership rights are not retained by the institution.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide reference to your data ownership documention.
questions.reason: This question clarifies the operating model of a solution provider and provides insight into the solution provider-customer paradigm of a company. Knowing whether the institution is of value to a solution provider or if the institution's data is of value to a solution provider should weigh heavily in the decision-making process.
questions.followup: If a solution provider's response is unsatisfactory, engage institutional counsel to appropriately address any ownership concerns.

questions.question: In the event of imminent bankruptcy, closing of business, or retirement of service, will you provide 90 days for customers to get their data out of the system and migrate applications?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Provide a detailed summary to support your selection.
questions.yes_guidance: State how the institution will be notified of imminent termination.
questions.reason: This question clarifies the position of the institution in the case of acquisition or bankruptcy. Expect clear responses to this question. If they are vague, be sure to follow up based on institutional counsel guidance.
questions.followup: If a solution provider's response is unsatisfactory, engage institutional counsel to appropriately address any ownership concerns.

questions.question: Are involatile backup copies made according to predefined schedules and securely stored and protected?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.standard_guidance: Ensure that response addresses involatile storage and lists retention periods.
questions.no_guidance: State how the institution's data is protected from system failures and ransomware.
questions.yes_guidance: If your strategy uses different processes for services and data, ensure that all strategies are clearly stated and supported.
questions.reason: Restricting system updates to a standard maintenance timeframe is important for ensuring that changes to production systems do not impact operations. It’s also important for troubleshooting any problems that may occur as a result of the changes. Availability is the focus of this question.
questions.followup: An institution's use case will drive the requirements for backup strategy. Ensure that the institution's use case and risk tolerance can be met by solution provider systems.

questions.question: Do you have a cryptographic key management process (generation, exchange, storage, safeguards, use, vetting, and replacement) that is documented and currently implemented, for all system components (e.g., database, system, web, etc.)?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.standard_guidance: Summarize your cryptographic key management process.
questions.no_guidance: Summarize your cryptographic key management process.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize your cryptographic key management process.
questions.reason: Understanding how key management is handled and the safeguards implemented by the solution provider to ensure key confidentiality in all components of a system(s) can provide insight into other complex details of a solution provider's infrastructure. Use solution provider responses to this question as a way to pivot to other infrastructure specifics, as needed to clarify potential risks.
questions.followup: Follow up with the solution provider to ensure that all components of the system are considered. This includes system-to-system, system-to-client, applications, system accounts, etc.

questions.question: Select your hosting option.
questions.if_then: If/then: If Self-managed, populate the solution provider answer for questions DCTR 02, 08, 16-18 with cell B25 in the Auto Responses sheet; If Physical co-location, populate solution provider answer for  DCTR 02-15 with B25; if Virtual Co-location, populate solution provider answer for DCTR 02-04, 07-08, 10, 16-18 with B25; If AWS, Azure, or GCP, populate 03, 07-08, 10, 16-18 with B25; if Other populate DCTR 02-03, 07-08, 10 with B25
questions.standard_guidance: If you are using an option not listed, or a combination of options, select "Other." Your selection here will determine which questions below are required.
questions.no_guidance: If you are using an option not listed, or a combination of options, select "Other." Your selection here will determine which questions below are required.
questions.yes_guidance: If you are using an option not listed, or a combination of options, select "Other." Your selection here will determine which questions below are required.
questions.reason: Understanding the hosting environment may reveal infrastructure risks that may not be apparent by other means and provides context to the responses provided throughout this HECVAT.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for hosting options will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Is a SOC 2 Type 2 report available for the hosting environment?
questions.yes_guidance: Obtain the report if possible and add it to your submission.
questions.reason: This question is relative to the response above. Understanding the ownership structure of the facility that will host institutional data is important for setting availability expectations and ensuring that proper contract terms are in place to protect the institution due to use of third parties. If a solution provider uses a third-party solution provider to provide data center solutions, having that solution provider's SOC 2 Type 2 provides additional insight. The ability to assess these "forth-party" solution providers is based on your institution's resources. The solution provider is responsible for providing this information; ensure that they handle their solution providers properly.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for additional solution provider's SOC 2 Type 2 reports will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Are you generally able to accommodate storing each institution's data within its geographic region?
questions.standard_guidance: Please indicate which geographic regions you can provide storage in the Additional Info column.
questions.no_guidance: Under what circumstances would institutional data leave a designated region or regions?
questions.yes_guidance: Please indicate which geographic regions you can provide storage in the Additional Info column.
questions.reason: An institution's location will dictate what laws and regulations apply. Because solution providers may not know where all of their customers reside, it is imperative that solution providers are able to accommodate geographic requirements for their customers. Although it is unfair to expect support for all geographic regions in common infrastructure/platform/software-as-a-service, solution providers are expected to be absolutely clear about the regions they leverage and/or support.
questions.followup: If a solution provider is unable to accommodate storing/processing institutional data within specific regions, ask them why they are unable to. Try to determine if it's an infrastructure issue (scalability), a cost-reduction strategy (size/maturity), or some other issue.

questions.question: Are the data centers staffed 24 hours a day, seven days a week (i.e., 24 x 7 x 365)?
questions.no_guidance: State any plans to staff data centers 24 x 7 x 365.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe the on-site staff capabilities.
questions.reason: Solution Providers that operate their own datacenter(s) can implement their own monitoring strategy. Use the solution provider's response to this questions to verify/validate other responses related to ownership/co-location/physical security.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for data center staffing will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Are your servers separated from other companies via a physical barrier, such as a cage or hard walls?
questions.no_guidance: State plans to separate your servers from others via a physical barrier.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe your physical barrier strategy.
questions.reason: This question is primarily focused on system integrity. If institutional data is stored in a system that is not physically secured from unauthorized access, the need for compensating controls is often higher. Depending on the use case or solution provider infrastructure, this may not be relevant.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for system physical security will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Does a physical barrier fully enclose the physical space, preventing unauthorized physical contact with any of your devices?*
questions.no_guidance: State plans to implement a physical barrier to prevent physical contact with any of your devices.
questions.reason: This question is primarily focused on system integrity. If institutional data is stored in a system that is not physically secured from unauthorized access, the need for compensating controls is often higher. Depending on the use case or solution provider infrastructure, this may not be relevant.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for system physical security will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Are your primary and secondary data centers geographically diverse?
questions.no_guidance: Describe any plans to implement.
questions.yes_guidance: State your primary and secondary data center locations. For cloud infrastructures, state the primary and secondary zones.
questions.reason: When planning for business continuity and disaster recovery, considering geographic diversity of a solution provider's operating environment will help analysts better understand risk due to widespread technical issues as well as weather and environmental considerations.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for geographic diversity in datacenters will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Is the service hosted in a high-availability environment?
questions.no_guidance: Describe any plans to implement a high-availability environment for your systems.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a summary to support your response selection.
questions.reason: In the context of the CIA triad, this question is focused on the availability of a system (or set of systems).
questions.followup: The weight placed on the solution provider's response will be specific to the institution's use case and solution requirements.

questions.question: Is redundant power available for all data centers where institutional data will reside?
questions.no_guidance: Describe any plans to implement a redundant power environment for your systems.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a detailed description of the implemented strategy (i.e.,batteries, generator).
questions.reason: In the context of the CIA triad, this question is focused on the availability of a system (or set of systems).
questions.followup: The weight placed on the solution provider's response will be specific to the institution's use case and solution requirements.

questions.question: Are redundant power strategies tested?*
questions.no_guidance: State plans to implement redundant power testing for your systems.
questions.yes_guidance: State how often redundant power strategies are tested and the date of the last successful test.
questions.reason: Installing (potential) redundant power and regularly testing strategies to ensure they will work when needed are very different. Vague responses to this question should be met with concern and appropriate follow up, based on your institution's risk tolerance.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for redundant power testing details will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Does the center where the data will reside have cooling and fire-suppression systems that are active and regularly tested?
questions.reason: Installing appropriate environmental controls is crucial to maintaining the integrity of the hosting site. Vague responses to this question should be met with concern and appropriate follow up, based on your institutions risk tolerance.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for cooling and fire suppression systems will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Do you have Internet Service Provider (ISP) redundancy?
questions.standard_guidance: State the ISP provider(s) in addition to the number of ISPs that provide connectivity.
questions.no_guidance: State the ISP provider(s) in addition to the number of ISPs that provide connectivity.
questions.yes_guidance: State how many Internet Service Providers (ISPs) provide connectivity to each data center where the institution's data will reside.
questions.reason: In the context of the CIA triad, this question is focused on the availability of a system (or set of systems).
questions.followup: The weight placed on the solution provider's response will be specific to the institution's use case and solution requirements.

questions.question: Does every data center where the institution's data will reside have multiple telephone company or network provider entrances to the facility?
questions.no_guidance: State plans to implement diversity of path in your network provider connections.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a brief description for each datacenter.
questions.reason: In the context of the CIA triad, this question is focused on the availability of a system (or set of systems).
questions.followup: The weight placed on the solution provider's response will be specific to the institution's use case and solution requirements.

questions.question: Do you require multifactor authentication for all administrative accounts in your environment?
questions.no_guidance: Describe plans to implement MFA.
questions.yes_guidance: State which model of MFA you are using.
questions.reason: 2FA/MFA, implemented correctly, strengthens the security state of a system. 2FA/MFA is commonly implemented and in many use cases is a requirement for account protection purposes.
questions.followup: Ask the solution provider about hardware and software options, future roadmap for implementations and support, etc.

questions.question: Are you using your cloud provider's available hardening tools or pre-hardened images?
questions.no_guidance: Describe how you alternately harden your images.
questions.reason: In the context of the CIA triad, this question is focused on the integrity of a system (or set of systems).
questions.followup: Ask the solution provider about their system lifecycle practices and security methodology.

questions.question: Does your cloud solution provider have access to your encryption keys?
questions.standard_guidance: Describe your key management practices.
questions.no_guidance: Describe your key management practices.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe your key management practices.
questions.reason: Understanding how key management is handled and the safeguards implemented by the solution provider to ensure key confidentiality in all components of a system(s) can provide insight into other complex details of a solution provider's infrastructure. Use solution provider responses to this question as a way to pivot to other infrastructure specifics, as needed to clarify potential risks.
questions.followup: Follow up with the solution provider to ensure that all components of the system are considered. This includes system-to-system, system-to-client, applications, system accounts, etc.

questions.question: Are you utilizing a stateful packet inspection (SPI) firewall?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe any plans to implement a SPI firewall.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe the currently implemented SPI firewall.
questions.reason: The use case, vendor infrastructure, and types of services offered will greatly affect the need for various firewalling devices. The focus of this question is integrity, ensuring that the systems hosting institutional data are limited in need-only communications.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for firewall capabilities will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Do you have a documented policy for firewall change requests?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe your plans to implement a documented policy for firewall change requests.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe your documented firewall change request policy.
questions.reason: In the context of the CIA triad, this question is focused on system integrity, ensuring that system changes are only executed by authorized users. Any change to a verified, known, secure environment should be carefully evaluated by stakeholders in a structured manner.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for firewall change requests will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Have you implemented an intrusion detection system (network-based)?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe your plan to implement an intrusion detection system in your environment.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe the currently implemented IDS.
questions.reason: It is important to have detective capabilities in an information system to protect institutional data. Because this is somewhat expected in information systems, solution providers without IDSs implemented should raise concerns. Compensating controls need future evaluation, if provided by the solution provider.
questions.followup: A security program with limited resources for event detection is not effective. Inquiries should include training for staff, reasoning behind not using IDS technologies, and how systems are monitored. Additional questions about a SIEM and other tool may be appropriate.

questions.question: Do you employ host-based intrusion detection?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe your plan to implement host-based intrusion detection system capabilities in your environment.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe the currently implemented host-based IDS solution(s).
questions.na_guidance: Please explain why this does not apply to your product or service.
questions.reason: It is important to have detective capabilities in an information system to protect institutional data. Because this is somewhat expected in information systems, solution providers without IDSs implemented should raise concerns. Compensating controls need future evaluation, if provided by the solution provider.
questions.followup: Ask the solution provider to summarize why host-based intrusion detection tools are not implemented in their environment. What compensating controls are in place to detect configuration changes and/or failures of integrity?

questions.question: Are audit logs available for all changes to the network, firewall, IDS, and IPS systems?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State plans to implement auditing capabilities for your network, firewall, IDS, and/or IPS.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe your current network systems logging strategy.
questions.reason: Strong logging capabilities are vital to the proper management of a network. Implementing an immature system that lacks sufficient logging capabilities exposes an institution to great risk.
questions.followup: If a weak response is given to this answer, it is an indicator that a nontechnical representative populated the document and response scrutiny should be increased. If a solution provider does not answer appropriately, a follow-up request to have the question fully answered is appropriate.

questions.question: Is authority for firewall change approval documented? Please list approver names or titles in Additional Info.
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe how firewall changes are approved.
questions.yes_guidance: List approver names or titles.
questions.reason: Modifications to firewall rule sets can have significant repercussions. To ensure the integrity of the rule set, this question targets the individual (or responsible party) for changes and the reasoning behind their authority.
questions.followup: Ensure that a separation of duties exists in network security configurations. Pay close attention to responsibility overlap in small organizations, where staff often fill multiple roles.

questions.question: Have you implemented an intrusion prevention system (network-based)?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe your plan to implement an intrusion prevention system in your environment.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe the currently implemented IPS.
questions.reason: It is important to have preventive capabilities in an information system to protect institutional data. Because this is somewhat expected in information systems, solution providers without IPSs implemented should raise concerns. Compensating controls need future evaluation, if provided by the solution provider.
questions.followup: A security program with limited resources for active prevention is inefficient. Inquiries should include training for staff, reasoning behind not using IPS technologies, and how systems are actively protected and how malicious activity is stopped.

questions.question: Do you employ host-based intrusion prevention?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe your plan to implement host-based intrusion prevention system capabilities in your environment.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe the currently implemented host-based IPS solution(s).
questions.na_guidance: Please explain why this does not apply to your product or service.
questions.reason: It is important to have preventive capabilities in an information system to protect institutional data. Because this is somewhat expected in information systems, solution providers without IPSs implemented should raise concerns. Compensating controls need future evaluation, if provided by the solution provider.
questions.followup: Ask the solution provider to summarize why host-based intrusion prevention tools are not implemented in their environment. What compensating controls are in place to detect malicious activity and to actively prevent its function?

questions.question: Are you employing any next-generation persistent threat (NGPT) monitoring?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe your intent to implement NGPT monitoring.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe your NGPT monitoring strategy.
questions.reason: This question is primarily focused on determining the maturity of a solution provider's security program and their ability to implement and operate cutting-edge technologies. Investment in advanced technologies may indicate appropriate security program capabilities.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for next-generation persistent threat monitoring will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Is intrusion monitoring performed internally or by a third-party service?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.standard_guidance: In addition to stating your intrusion monitoring strategy, provide a brief summary of its implementation.
questions.no_guidance: In addition to stating your intrusion monitoring strategy, provide a brief summary of its implementation.
questions.yes_guidance: In addition to stating your intrusion monitoring strategy, provide a brief summary of its implementation.
questions.reason: This question is primarily focused on the capability of a solution provider's security program. Understanding the size and skillsets of a solution provider (taken from other responses) is needed to determine the appropriateness of the solution provider's response to this question.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for intrusion monitoring will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Do you monitor for intrusions on a 24 x 7 x 365 basis?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State plans to implement 24 x 7 x 365 intrusion monitoring in your environment(s).
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a brief summary of this activity.
questions.reason: This question is primarily focused on system(s) integrity. If institutional data is stored in a system that is not physically secured from unauthorized access, the need for compensating controls is often higher. Depending on the use case or solution provider infrastructure, this may not be relevant.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for 24 x 7 x 365 monitoring will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Do you have a documented patch management process?*
questions.reason: In the context of the CIA triad, this question is focused on system integrity, ensuring that system changes are only executed according to policy. Additionally, it is expected that devices used to access the solution provider's systems are properly managed and secured.
questions.followup: Follow up with a robust question set if the solution provider cannot clearly state full control of their system patching strategy. Questions about patch testing, testing environments, threat mitigation, incident remediation, etc., are appropriate.

questions.question: Can your organization comply with institutional policies on privacy and data protection with regard to users of institutional systems, if required?*
questions.no_guidance: Summarize why you will not comply with the institution's IT policy with regards to user privacy and data protection.
questions.yes_guidance: State that you have reviewed the institution's IT policies with regards to user privacy and data protection.
questions.reason: This is a general inquiry to determine if the solution provider has reviewed the institution's policies and is committed to complying with them.
questions.followup: If a solution provider is vague in their response, follow up with direct questions about the institution's policies and ensure the expectation of compliance is clear with the solution provider.

questions.question: Is your company subject to the institution's geographic region's laws and regulations?*
questions.standard_guidance: State the country that governs and regulates your company.
questions.no_guidance: State the country that governs and regulates your company.
questions.yes_guidance: State the country that governs and regulates your company.
questions.reason: This is a general inquiry to determine if the solution provider is well-versed in applicable laws and regulations that apply in the institution's region of business operation.
questions.followup: If a solution provider is vague in their response, follow up with direct questions about doing business in your state/region/country and any laws that are pertinent to the institution.

questions.question: Can you accommodate encryption requirements using open standards?
questions.reason: Beware the use of proprietary encryption implementations. Open standard encryption, preferably mature, is often preferred. Although there may be cases in which that is not the case, be sure to understand the solution provider's infrastructure and the true security of a solution provider's solution.
questions.followup: If the solution provider cannot accommodate open standards encryption requirements, direct them to NIST's Cryptographic Standards and Guidelines document <https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/Cryptographic-Standards-and-Guidelines>.

questions.question: Do you have a documented systems development life cycle (SDLC)?
questions.no_guidance: State any plans to implement an SDLC.
questions.yes_guidance: Briefly summarize your SDLC or provide a link or attachment.
questions.reason: Mature solution lifecycle management can position a solution provider to sufficiently plan, implement, and manage systems that better protect institutional data.
questions.followup: Although withdrawn by NIST, the Security Considerations in the Systems Development Life Cycle (SP 800-64r2) document is an excellent resource to provide guidance to solution providers (i.e., set expectations). Follow-up questions to SDLC use will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Do you perform background screenings or multi-state background checks on all employees prior to their first day of work?
questions.no_guidance: State plans to implement background check elements into your hiring process.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize your background check practices.
questions.reason: The use of detective and preventive controls in the hiring process serves a valuable role in protecting institutional data. As these are often HR documented policies, a solution provider should have their practices well-documented and ready for review, upon request.
questions.followup: Ask the solution provider if background checks and/or screening are conducted in any capacity, at any time during the employment period. Ask about the precautions they take to ensure the intellectual property is secured and inquire if user data is treated in an appropriate manner.

questions.question: Do you require new employees to fill out agreements and review policies?
questions.no_guidance: Summarize why new employees are not required to accept agreements or review policy.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize the required agreements and reviewed policies.
questions.reason: Setting the expectation of performance and increasing awareness of security-related responsibilities are part of these initial-hiring documents. Oftentimes these agreements and reviews are conducted during orientation for new employees.
questions.followup: If a solution provider's practices are not clear, inquire about training requirements for employees, especially the frequency and scope of content.

questions.question: Do you have a documented information security policy?
questions.no_guidance: State plans to implement information security policy at your company.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a reference to your information security policy or submit documentation with this fully populated HECVAT.
questions.reason: A shared security [responsibility] environment is expected of solution providers in today's world. Security offices alone cannot protect an institution's data. Information security, ingrained in an organization, is the best case scenario for the protection of institutional data. Security awareness and practice start in a solution provider's policies. The ability for the solution provider to respond effectively (and quickly) to a security incident is of the utmost importance. The size of a solution provider's security office will determine its capabilities during a security incident, but the incident response plan will oftentimes determine its effectiveness. Use the knowledge of this response when evaluating other solution provider statements, particularly when discussing degraded operation states.
questions.followup: If the solution provider does not have an incident response plan, point them to the NIST Computer Security Incident Handling Guide <https://csrc.nist.gov/publications/detail/sp/800-61/rev-2/final>.

questions.question: Are information security principles designed into the product lifecycle?
questions.no_guidance: State why security principles are not designed into the product lifecycle.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize the information security principles designed into the product lifecycle.
questions.reason: The adherence to secure coding best practices better positions a solution provider to maintain the CIA triad. Use the knowledge of this response when evaluating other solution provider statements, particularly those focused on development and the protection of communications.
questions.followup: If information security principles are not designed into the product lifecycle, point the solution provider to OWASP's Secure Coding Practices - Quick Reference Guide <https://www.owasp.org/index.php/OWASP_Secure_Coding_Practices_-_Quick_Reference_Guide>.

questions.question: Will you comply with applicable breach notification laws?
questions.no_guidance: Summarize why you will not comple with applicable breach notification laws.
questions.yes_guidance: State how quickly the institution will be notified of a data breach or security incident.
questions.reason: This is a general inquiry to determine if the solution provider is well-versed in applicable laws and regulations that apply in the institution's region of business operation.
questions.followup: If a solution provider is vague in their response, follow up with direct questions about doing business in your state/region/country and any laws that are pertinent to the institution.

questions.question: Do you have an information security awareness program?
questions.no_guidance: State plans to implement an information security awareness program.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize your information security awareness program.
questions.reason: Setting the expectation of security-related responsibilities throughout an organzation is favored in an information security awareness program. Solution Providers without an information security awareness campaign should be met with scrutiny on how security policies and procedures are implemented in their environment.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for information security awareness programs will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Is security awareness training mandatory for all employees?
questions.no_guidance: State plans to make security awareness training mandatory for all employees.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize your security awareness training content and state how frequently employees are required to undergo security awareness training.
questions.reason: Setting the expectation of security-related responsibilities throughout an organzation is favored in an information security awareness program. Solution Providers without an information security awareness campaign should be met with scrutiny on how security policies and procedures are implemented in their environment.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for information security awareness programs will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Do you have process and procedure(s) documented, and currently followed, that require a review and update of the access list(s) for privileged accounts?
questions.no_guidance: Describe plans to implement privileged account access list reviews to your environment.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a brief summary and the implement review interval.
questions.reason: Protecting privileged accounts is crucial to maintaining system integrity in any environment. This question is targeting privilege creep and unmanaged privileged acccounts to determine if the solution provider properly manages access control in their application/system environments.
questions.followup: Ask the solution provider to summarize their implemented policies and/or procedures.

questions.question: Do you have documented, and currently implemented, internal audit processes and procedures?
questions.no_guidance: State plans to document and implement internal audit process and procedure in your environment.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize your internal audit processes and procedures.
questions.reason: The role of an internal auditor is to verify implemented controls and highlight areas in need of improvement. Solution Providers without internal audit processes and procedures should be met with scrutiny on how security policies and procedures are monitored and verified in their environment.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for internal audit processes and procedures will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Does your organization have physical security controls and policies in place?
questions.no_guidance: Describe your intent to implement physical security controls and policies.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a copy of your physical security controls and policies along with this document (link or attached).
questions.na_guidance: Please explain why this does not apply to your organization, product or service.
questions.reason: This question aims to understand the physical security state of the solution provider's operating environment and whether or not physical assets are appropriately protected.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for physical security controls and policies will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Do you have a formal incident response plan?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State plans to formalize an incident response plan.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize or provide a link to your formal incident response plan.
questions.reason: The ability for the solution provider to respond effectively (and quickly) to a security incident is of the utmost importance. The size of a solution provider's security office will determine their capabilities during a security incident, but the incident response plan will oftentimes determine their effectiveness. Use the knowledge of this response when evaluating other solution provider statements, particularly when discussing degraded operation states.
questions.followup: If the solution provider does not have an incident response plan, direct them to the NIST Computer Security Incident Handling Guide <https://csrc.nist.gov/publications/detail/sp/800-61/rev-2/final>.

questions.question: Do you either have an internal incident response team or retain an external team?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe your timeline for implementing such a process for response and reporting.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize your incident response and reporting processes.
questions.reason: The ability for the solution provider to investigate security incidents is of the utmost importance. Reviewing alerts but then taking no action is not security, only compliance. Incident reports and indications of compromise must be reviewed by qualified staff, and they must have the capability to investigate further, as needed.
questions.followup: If the solution provider does not have an incident response plan, direct them to the NIST Computer Security Incident Handling Guide <https://csrc.nist.gov/publications/detail/sp/800-61/rev-2/final>.

questions.question: Do you have the capability to respond to incidents on a 24 x 7 x 365 basis?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State plans for acquiring internal resources or an external team.
questions.yes_guidance: Summarize your internal approach or reference your third-party contractor.
questions.reason: The incident team structure (internal vs. external), size, and capabilities of a solution provider have a significant impact on their ability to respond to and protect an institution's data. Use the knowledge of this response when evaluating other solution provider statements.
questions.followup: If the solution provider does not have an incident response team, direct them to the NIST Computer Security Incident Handling Guide <https://csrc.nist.gov/publications/detail/sp/800-61/rev-2/final>.

questions.question: Do you carry cyber-risk insurance to protect against unforeseen service outages, data that is lost or stolen, and security incidents?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State plans to implement coverage in the future or how you can provide breach/liabilty coverage to the institution without it.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe the coverage in place for this solution.
questions.reason: The capacity for the solution provider to respond effectively (and quickly) to a security incident is of the utmost importance. The size and talent of a solution provider's incident response team will determine their capabilities during a security incident. Use the knowledge of this response when evaluating other solution provider statements, particularly when discussing degraded operation states.
questions.followup: If the solution provider does not have an incident response plan, point them to the NIST Computer Security Incident Handling Guide <https://csrc.nist.gov/publications/detail/sp/800-61/rev-2/final>.

questions.question: Are your systems and applications scanned with an authenticated user account for vulnerabilities (that are remediated) prior to new releases?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe plans to implement application vulnerability scanning (and remediation) prior to release.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a brief description.
questions.reason: Modern technologies allow for rapid deployment of features, and with them come changes to an established code environment. The focus of this question is to verify a solution provider's practice of regression testing their code and verifying that previously nonexistent risks are not introduced into a known, secured environment.
questions.followup: Ask if there are plans to implement these processes. Ask the solution provider to summarize their decision behind not scanning their applications for vulnerabilities prior to release.

questions.question: Will you provide results of application and system vulnerability scans to the institution?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe why security scan results will not be provided to the institution.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a reference to security scan documentation.
questions.reason: If a solution provider is scanning its applications and/or systems, oftentimes an institution will want to review the report, if possible. Preferably, any finding on the reports will have a matching mitigation action.
questions.followup: If a solution provider is hesitant to share the report, ask for a summarized version; some insight is better than none.

questions.question: Will you allow the institution to perform its own vulnerability testing and/or scanning of your systems and/or application, provided that testing is performed at a mutually agreed upon time and date?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Provide a brief summary for your response.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide reference to the process or procedure to set up security testing times and scopes.
questions.reason: Many higher education institutions are capable of performing vulnerability assessments and/or penetration testing on their solution providers' infrastructures. This question confirms the possibility of conducting these actions against the solution provider's infrastructure.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for vulnerability scanning and penetration testing will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Have your systems and applications had a third-party security assessment completed in the last year?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State plans to have your systems and applications assessed by a third party.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide the results with this document (link or attached), if possible. State the date of the last completed third-party security assessment.
questions.reason: External verification of system and application security controls are important when managing a system. Trust, but verify, is the focus of this question. HECVAT responses are taken at face value and verified within reason, in most cases. When a solution provider can attest to and provide externally provided evidence supporting that attestation, it goes a long way in building trust that the solution provider will appropriately protect institutional data.
questions.followup: Ask if there has ever been a vulnerability scan. A short lapse in external assessment validity can be understood (if there is a planned assessment), but a significant time lapse or no scan whatsoever is cause for elevated levels of concern.

questions.question: Do you regularly scan for common web application security vulnerabilities (e.g., SQL injection, XSS, XSRF, etc.)?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.standard_guidance: Ensure that all elements of VULN-05 are clearly stated in your response.
questions.no_guidance: Ensure that all elements of VULN-05 are clearly stated in your response.
questions.yes_guidance: Ensure that all elements of VULN-05 are clearly stated in your response.
questions.reason: The adherence to secure coding best practices better positions a solution provider to maintain the CIA triad. Use the knowledge of this response when evaluating other solution provider statements, particularly those focused on development and the protection of communications. Solution Providers should be monitoring for and addressing these issues in their solutions.
questions.followup: If information security principles are not designed into the product lifecycle, point the solution provider to OWASP's Secure Coding Practices - Quick Reference Guide <https://www.owasp.org/index.php/OWASP_Secure_Coding_Practices_-_Quick_Reference_Guide>. Inquire about the tools a solution provider uses, the interval at which systems are monitored/mitigated, and who is responsible for the process/procedure in place for this monitoring.

questions.question: Are your systems and applications regularly scanned externally for vulnerabilities?
questions.if_then: If REQU-01 is no, populate solution provider answer with B2 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe any plans to implement external vulnerability scanning for your applications.
questions.yes_guidance: Decribe your external application vulnerability scanning strategy.
questions.reason: External verification of application security controls is important when managing a system. Trust, but verify, is the focus of this question. HECVAT responses are taken at face value and verified within reason, in most cases. When a solution provider can attest to and provide externally provided evidence supporting that attestation, it goes a long way in building trust that the solution provider will appropriately protect institutional data.
questions.followup: If "no," inquire if there has ever been a vulnerability scan. A short lapse in external assessment validity can be understood (if there is a planned assessment), but a significant time lapse or no scan whatsoever is cause for elevated levels of concern.

questions.question: Do your workforce members receive regular training related to the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) Privacy and Security Rules and the HITECH Act?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-05 is no, populate solution provider answer with B6 in Auto Responses tab
questions.standard_guidance: Refer to HIPAA regulations documentation for supplemental guidance in this section.
questions.no_guidance: Refer to HIPAA regulations documentation for supplemental guidance in this section.
questions.yes_guidance: Refer to HIPAA regulations documentation for supplemental guidance in this section.
questions.reason: HIPAA
questions.followup: Refer to HIPAA documentation or your institution's Chief HIPAA Security Officer.

questions.question: Have you identified areas of risk?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-05 is no, populate solution provider answer with B6 in Auto Responses tab
questions.standard_guidance: Refer to HIPAA regulations documentation for supplemental guidance in this section.
questions.no_guidance: Refer to HIPAA regulations documentation for supplemental guidance in this section.
questions.yes_guidance: Refer to HIPAA regulations documentation for supplemental guidance in this section.
questions.reason: HIPAA
questions.followup: Refer to HIPAA documentation or your institution's Chief HIPAA Security Officer.

questions.question: Have the relevant policies/plans been tested?*
questions.if_then: If REQU-05 is no, populate solution provider answer with B6 in Auto Responses tab
questions.standard_guidance: Refer to HIPAA regulations documentation for supplemental guidance in this section.
questions.no_guidance: Refer to HIPAA regulations documentation for supplemental guidance in this section.
questions.yes_guidance: Refer to HIPAA regulations documentation for supplemental guidance in this section.
questions.reason: HIPAA
questions.followup: Refer to HIPAA documentation or your institution's Chief HIPAA Security Officer.

questions.question: Do you support role-based access control (RBAC) for system administrators?
questions.if_then: If REQU-07 is no, populate solution provider answer with B8 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe any limitations to your roles-based approach.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe your RBAC.
questions.reason: Managing a solution may rely on various professionals to administer a system. This question is focused on how administration, and the segregation of functions, can be implemented within the system. Securing the administration portion of a system has additional implications (e.g., logging, administration, etc.) beyond that of end users.
questions.followup: Ask the solution provider to summarize the best practices for securing their system(s) administratively without the use of RBAC. Make sure to understand the administrative requirements/overhead introduced in the solution provider's environment.

questions.question: Can your employees access customer systems remotely?
questions.if_then: If REQU-07 is no, populate solution provider answer with B8 in Auto Responses tab
questions.yes_guidance: Describe the tools and technical controls implemented to secure remote access.
questions.reason: Telecommuting in the IT world is common. An institution should know that proper safeguards are in place if remote access is allowed. Solution Provider responses vary greatly on this, so confirm the context of the response if it is not clear. Many cloud services can only be managed remotely, so there is often a gray area to interpret for this response.
questions.followup: Ask the solution provider to summarize the reasoning behind this business process and request additional documentation that outlines the security controls implemented to safeguard institutional data.

questions.question: Can you provide overall system and/or application architecture diagrams including a full description of the data communications architecture for all components of the system?
questions.if_then: If REQU-07 is no, populate solution provider answer with B8 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State any plans to provide system and/or application architecture diagrams.
questions.yes_guidance: Provide a reference to the requested documents or provide them when submitting this fully populated HECVAT.
questions.reason: Many systems can be used a variety of ways. We want these implementation type diagrams so that we can understand the "real" use of the solution.
questions.followup: Additional requests for documentation are made when other parts of the HECVAT are insufficient. Although supporting documentation is helpful, many solution providers do not provide it. We try to be specific with our follow-up questions so that solution providers understand we are not looking for 20-50 page whitepapers (sales documentation).

questions.question: Do you require remote management of the system?
questions.if_then: If REQU-07 is no, populate solution provider answer with B8 in Auto Responses tab
questions.yes_guidance: Describe the tools and technical controls implemented to secure remote access.
questions.reason: Telecommuting in the IT world is common. An institution should know that proper safeguards are in place, if remote access is allowed. Solution Provider responses vary greatly on this, so confirm the context of the response if it is not clear. Many cloud services can only be managed remotely, so there is often a gray area to interpret for this response.
questions.followup: Ask the solution provider to summarize the reasoning behind this business process and request additional documentation that outlines the security controls implemented to safeguard institutional data.

questions.question: If you answered "yes" to OPEM-04, are your remote actions and changes logged or otherwise visible to the campus?
questions.if_then: If REQU-07 is no, populate solution provider answer with B8 in Auto Responses tab
questions.yes_guidance: Describe how these logs are made available.
questions.na_guidance: Please explain why this does not apply to your product or service.
questions.reason: Strong logging capabilities are vital to the proper management of a system. Implementing an immature system that lacks sufficient logging capabilities exposes an institution to great risk. Depending on your risk tolerance and the use case, your institution may or may not be concerned. The focus of this question is remote access logging.
questions.followup: If a weak response is given to this answer, it is appropriate to ask directed answers to get specific information. Ensure that questions are targeted to ensure responses will come from the appropriate party within the solution provider.

questions.question: If you maintain remote access to the system, will you handle data in a FERPA-compliant manner?
questions.if_then: If REQU-07 is no, populate solution provider answer with B8 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: State plans to handle data in a FERPA-compliant manner.
questions.yes_guidance: Describe how FERPA compliance is integrated into your process and procedures.
questions.na_guidance: Please explain why this does not apply to your product or service.
questions.reason: This is standard documentation, relevant to institution implementations requiring FERPA compliance.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for FERPA compliance details will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Do you support campus status monitoring through SNMPv3 or other means?
questions.if_then: If REQU-07 is no, populate solution provider answer with B8 in Auto Responses tab
questions.no_guidance: Describe your plans to support monitoring.
questions.yes_guidance: Please describe your monitoring support.
questions.reason: Standard documentation question. With an on-premise device, the possibility to tie-in with existing monitoring/management systems is beneficial. The solution provider's response should be clear and concise.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for monitoring via SNMPv3 will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Describe or provide a reference to any other safeguards used to monitor for malicious activity.
questions.if_then: If REQU-07 is no, populate solution provider answer with B8 in Auto Responses tab
questions.standard_guidance: Please detail your monitoring strategy
questions.no_guidance: Please detail your monitoring strategy
questions.yes_guidance: Please detail your monitoring strategy
questions.reason: This question is primarily focused on system(s) integrity and confidentiality. The solution provider's response should clearly state the system(s) capabilities to properly monitor for (and alert for) malicious activity.
questions.followup: Follow-up inquiries for system monitoring will be institution/implementation specific.

questions.question: Describe how long your organization has conducted business in this area.
questions.if_then: If REQU-07 is no, populate solution provider answer with B8 in Auto Responses tab
questions.standard_guidance: Include the number of years and in what capacity.
